issue.title: I/O manipulators should be specified in terms of base classes

discussion.p: All the manipulators in and use language of the form:
discussion.blockquote: An object of unspecified type such that if out is an object of type basic_ostream<charT, traits> then the expression out << resetiosflags(mask) behaves as if [...]
discussion.p: This needs to work for any object with a public and unambiguous base class of type basic_ostream<charT, traits>, not only objects of exactly that type.
In C++98 and C++03, setfill did actually get this right ("if out is (or is derived from) basic_ostream<charT,traits>"), but that was "fixed" for C++11 to be consistent with the other manipulators.
is slightly different, talking about "an instance of basic_ostream", but that's not right either.
